alert.note: Alert for Baraga; Dickinson; Gogebic; Houghton; Iron; Keweenaw; Marquette; Menominee; Ontonagon; Southern Houghton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 21 at 3:09PM EST until December 25 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM EST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches with some locally higher amounts tonight through Thursday...heaviest in the higher terrain areas of Ontonagon and Goegebic Counties. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions with snow and low visibilities possible late Thursday night through Saturday night. Heavy snow will be possible in northwest lake effect snow belts. Winds could gust as high as 45 to 60 mph Friday through Saturday with the highest winds near the Lake Superior shoreline. * WHERE...Portions of central Upper and western Upper Michigan. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 7 PM this evening to 7 PM EST Thursday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Thursday evening through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact multiple morning and evening commutes tonight through Sunday. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snow will start first in Gogebic and Ontonagon Counties late this afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Baraga; Dickinson; Gogebic; Houghton; Iron; Keweenaw; Marquette; Menominee; Ontonagon; Southern Houghton
